article_title: Claim Check: Americans for Prosperity accuses Begich of missing votes
article_text: "Mark Begich has Alaska's best congressional attendance record and is always ready to go to work for Alaska. That means working in Washington, traveling thousands of miles across Alaska to listen to Alaskans and talking issues at Home Depot," spokesman Max Croes wrote in an emailed statement. "This ad proves the Koch brothers will say anything in their attempts to buy Alaska's Senate seat for (Republican opponent) Dan Sullivan."

article_metadata.description: A new ad from conservative group Americans for Prosperity accuses Alaska U.S. Sen. Mark Begich of not showing up for his job, missing more votes last year than 80 percent of his colleagues. We checked to see if that was true.

og.description: A new ad from conservative group Americans for Prosperity accuses Alaska U.S. Sen. Mark Begich of not showing up for his job, missing more votes last year than 80 percent of his colleagues. We checked to see if that was true.
og.title: Claim Check: Americans for Prosperity accuses Begich of missing votes

article_summary:
"Mark Begich has Alaska's best congressional attendance record and is always ready to go to work for Alaska.
That means working in Washington, traveling thousands of miles across Alaska to listen to Alaskans and talking issues at Home Depot," spokesman Max Croes wrote in an emailed statement.
"This ad proves the Koch brothers will say anything in their attempts to buy Alaska's Senate seat for (Republican opponent) Dan Sullivan."
